subject: Re: American spelling for -ire terminals?
msgSnippet: ... know ... pronunciation ... indicated ... spelling ... above ... there is ... word ... four ... The British pronunciation for this combination does not lack
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "steveb_667" <
sbartok1632@e...> wrote:
> For words like "desire," "mire," "fire" & "tire," I would like to
know
> if there is a difference between the British & American
pronunciation
> of those words. In the Quikscript manual on page 13, it is
indicated
> that the "ire" in "mire" should be spelt #31+#25. Does this
spelling
> presume the presense of a slight "-er" sound in each of the
above
> examples or does the British pronunciation differ such that
there is
> no "-er" sound in the above words (such as the "pir-" in the
word
> "pirate" has very little "-er" sound when compared to the first
four
> examples)?
>
> Thank you.

The British pronunciation for this combination does not lack a
schwa. I think the reason that the "-er" isn't written out is
because it would require a pen lift whereas omitting it doesn't
and won't create any ambiguity.
